Package edu.jsu.mcis

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArgsParser
    This program allows the user to add arguments and enter data values into them from the command line.
    Argument
    This is the abstract class that is the parent class for the namedArgument and positionalArgument classes.
    namedArgument
    This program creates a namedArgument class that extends Argument class.
    It has methods that allow the user to get the description, the value and the data type of the argument.
    Named arguments are not required arguments that have to be called in the comand prompt to change the value
    positionalArgument
    This program creates a positionalArgument class that extends Argument class.
    It has methods that allow the user to get the description, the value and the data type of the argument.
    Positional arguments have a specific order that they have to be entered in the comand prompt to change thier value.
    readWriteXML  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Argument.Type  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    HelpMessageException
    This creates HelpMessageException class to handle Help Message Exception and extends from RunTime Exception.
    It occurs when --help or -h is entered into the command prompt
    InvalidNameException
    This creates InvalidNameException class to handle Invalid Name Exception and extends from RunTime Exception.
    It occurs when a name that does not corrispond to any argument is entered from the user program.
    NoSuchArgumentException
    This creates NoSuchArgumentException class to handle a case where there is No Such Argument present, and it extends from RunTime Exception.
    this occurs when a named argument is called in the command prompt but it does not exist in the program.
    TooFewArgumentsException
    This creates TooFewArgumentsException class to handle a case where there are Too Few Arguments present, and it extends from RunTime Exception.
    This occurs when not enough postional arguments are entered in the command prompt
    TooManyArgumentsException
    This creates TooManyArgumentsException class to handle a case where there are Too Many Arguments present, and it extends from RunTime Exception.
    This occurs when too many postional arguments are entered in the command prompt
    WrongFormatException
    This creates WrongFormatException class to handle a case where the Format is Wrong, and it extends from RunTime Exception.
